Package processing.video

Class Capture

java.lang.Object
processing.core.PImage
processing.video.Capture
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, processing.core.PConstants
public class Capture extends processing.core.PImage implements processing.core.PConstants
Datatype for storing and manipulating video frames from an attached capture device such as a camera. Use Capture.list() to show the names of any attached devices. Using the version of the constructor without name will attempt to use the last device used by a QuickTime program.
Usage:
application

  • Method Details

    • dispose

      public void dispose()
      Disposes all the native resources associated to this capture device. NOTE: This is not official API and may/will be removed at any time.

    • frameRate

      public void frameRate(float ifps)
      Sets how often frames are read from the capture device. Setting the fps parameter to 4, for example, will cause 4 frames to be read per second.
      Parameters:
      ifps - speed of the capture device in frames per second
      In brief:
      Sets the target frame rate
      Usage:
      web_application

    • available

      public boolean available()
      Returns "true" when a new frame from the device is available to read.
      In brief:
      Returns "true" when a new frame is available to read.
      Usage:
      web_application

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts capturing frames from the selected device.
      In brief:
      Starts video capture
      Usage:
      web_application

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops capturing frames from an attached device.
      In brief:
      Stops video capture
      Usage:
      web_application

    • read

      public void read()
      Reads the current frame of the device.
      In brief:
      Reads the current frame
      Usage:
      web_application

    • setBufferSink

      public void setBufferSink(Object sink)
      Sets the object to use as destination for the frames read from the stream. The color conversion mask is automatically set to the one required to copy the frames to OpenGL. NOTE: This is not official API and may/will be removed at any time.
      Parameters:
      Object - dest

    • hasBufferSink

      public boolean hasBufferSink()
      NOTE: This is not official API and may/will be removed at any time.

      NOTE: This is not official API and may/will be removed at any time.

    • post

      public void post()

    • list

      public static String[] list()
      Returns a list of all capture devices, using the device's pretty display name. Multiple devices can have identical display names, appending ' #n' to devices with duplicate display names.
      Returns:
      array of device names

      public static String[] getCapabilities(String device)
